summary: The text discusses the prophetic timing of Christ's death and the consequences for the Jewish people who rejected Him. It refers to the prophecy of 70 weeks, indicating that after this period, Christ would be killed and the people who denied Him would face the devastation of their city and sanctuary. It uses this prophecy to assert that Christ has already come and questions the Jewish people about the reason for their prolonged suffering and captivity, suggesting it is due to their sins and lack of repentance.
